alert.note: Alert for Atascosa; Bexar; Comal; Medina (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 22 at 3:47AM CST until January 22 at 5:00AM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING FOR NORTHWESTERN ATASCOSA, WESTERN BEXAR, COMAL AND SOUTHEASTERN MEDINA COUNTIES... At 347 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... San Antonio, New Braunfels, Schertz, Live Oak, Selma, Devine, Castroville, San Antonio Int Airport, Canyon Lake Dam, Canyon Lake, Leon Valley, Helotes, Fair Oaks Ranch, Alamo Heights, Windcrest, Terrell Hills, Bulverde, Garden Ridge, Shavano Park and Hollywood Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
